body.para: The compiler could not verify that the out parameter was assigned a value before it was used; its value may be undefined when assigned. Be sure to assign a value to out parameters in the called method before accessing the value. If you need to use the value of the variable passed in, use a ref parameter instead. For more information, see Passing Parameters.
This could also occur if the initialization of a variable occurs in a try block, which the compiler is unable to verify will execute successfully:
